level.text: A support order or income-withholding order issued in another state is registered when the order is filed in the registering tribunal of the District.
A registered order issued in another state is enforceable in the same manner and is subject to the same procedures as an order issued by a tribunal of the District.
Except as otherwise provided in this subchapter, a tribunal of the District shall recognize and enforce, but may not modify, a registered order if the issuing tribunal had jurisdiction.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 11-81
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 11-81, see Historical and Statutory Notes following ยง 46-301.01.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Uniform Law: This section is based upon ยง 603 of the Uniform Interstate Family Support Act (2001 Act).
